etymology.description: 耳(耳) (ěr, "ear") + 王(王) (wáng, "king") = ear of the king -> sacred
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 耳(耳) (ěr, "ear") and 王(王) (wáng, "king") in its traditional form, symbolizing the concept of sacredness or holiness by alluding to a ruler who listens attentively.
etymology.simplification: The traditional character 聖 was simplified to 圣 by removing the components 耳(耳) (ěr, "ear") and modifying the remaining part to retain phonetic and semantic elements in a more concise form.

examples.chinese: 这座寺庙被视为圣地(這座寺廟被視為聖地)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò sìmiào bèi shìwéi shèngdì.
examples.english: This temple is regarded as a sacred place.

examples.chinese: 她的微笑让人感受到一种圣洁的温暖(她的微笑讓人感受到一種聖潔的溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de wéixiào ràng rén gǎnshòudào yī zhǒng shèngjié de wēnnuǎn.
examples.english: Her smile evokes a sense of sacred warmth.

examples.chinese: 他在祈祷时虔诚地低语(他在祈禱時虔誠地低語)，心中充满圣意(心中充滿聖意)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài qídǎo shí qiánchéng de dīyǔ, xīnzhōng chōngmǎn shèngyì.
examples.english: He whispered devoutly in prayer, his heart full of sacred intent.
